reviews.text: Myself and wife wanted a linked room for our 2 children (5 and 7). room 8 was perfect. Thanks to our host for a very good stay with a great breakfast (to order with specific requests for the boys)and helpful hints about local amenities. Will stay again.
reviews.title: Russell and family

reviews.text: The Boston Lodge is a very good B and B. We were warmly welcomed on arrival and shown to our room, which was spotless and comfortable.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: We only stayed one night but would be more than happy to stay longer should circumstances require. Breakfast in the morning was cooked to order, well presented and set us up for the day.
reviews.title: Excellent Value For Money, Clean and Comfortable B & B

reviews.text: A very positive experience and we will certainly return to the Boston Lodge.
reviews.title: very friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grandparents with a 6 year old Grandson, our criteria was quiet, clean, spacious family room, varied choice of breakfast with en-suite bathroom, we were also on a tight budget. We were more than pleased with the hosts and the facilities on offer. Our family room was spotless, crisp clean white bedding, stunning views of the countryside from our window. The owner Patrick asked what we would like for breakfast nothing was too much trouble for him, he and his wife were polite and friendly (not over friendly!). We stayed for 2 nights over the weekend, We will be returning, very cheap rates with high standards of service.
reviews.title: Very good value for money

reviews.text: We had a great stay at the hotel in one of the family rooms. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfy. The owner was very friendly and welcoming.
reviews.title: Fantastic value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was lovely. The owner, Patrick, was very accommodating and made sure our toddler had whatever he wanted!
reviews.title: Welcoming haven in Lincolnshire countryside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, it was a fantastic place to stay and such great value for money.
reviews.title: O.K for 1 nights stay, but no luxuries !

reviews.text: The fact that we're repeat visitors to Boston Lodge says all there is to say where our opinion is concerned: we travel widely, use lots of hotels throughout the UK, and wouldn't dream of giving repeat business to any accommodation provider if we hadn't had value for money.
reviews.title: Another excellent stay

reviews.text: By that yardstick alone, Boston Lodge is worthy of the 5-star rating we give here: £52 for two people in spotlessly clean, quiet, comfortable accommodation including a superb full English breakfast? C'mon. Let's get real. None of the budget chain hotels get near that figure, not when you factor in the seemingly ever-increasing price of breakfasts per head.
reviews.title: Ok but wouldn't go back

reviews.text: Booked for just one night but would have no problem going back for longer if required. Patrick the owner greeted us and showed us to our rooms(3), he made a point of learning our first names.The rooms were very clean,comfortable and well presented. The shower wasn't the greatest but adequate.It was a pleasant change to stay somewhere with some character rather than the sterile 'Travelodge' type establishments.
reviews.title: A pleasant change

reviews.text: The breakfasts were cooked to order and really set us up for the day.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plenty of on site parking.
reviews.title: Very friendly

reviews.text: We used the 'Barge' across the road(recommended by Patrick) for our evening meal which was really nice.
reviews.title: The Thorpe family review!!

reviews.text: We travelled from Manchester to the Norfolk Broads and stayed at the Boston Lodge with the dog and 13 year son as an overnight stay. The room was large enough for us all, breakfast was excellent and Patrick, the owner was very welcoming, We would definately use this place again if we ever went back to that part of the world.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: My colleague and I stayed here for 4 nights. We found the place had a musky smell but appeared to be dry. The beds were clean and the room was only brushed over and bleach put down the toilet (this was evident as it took your breath away). My room (6) had a very small box type toilet and the shower (very temperamental0 had a mind of it's own. If you wasn't careful you could possibly get scalded, and the basin was in the main part of the bedroom. It was sold to us as having an en-suit. The walls were paper thin and you could hear people in the next room having a normal conversation. My colleague had no shower for 3 out of the 4 nights we stayed, although this was brought to the attention of our host. Each day he assured her that it was now fixed. Next time were in Boston we'll being staying elsewhere. We felt that this place was over priced at £45.00 per night for the standard of service we received.
reviews.title: Not again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a last minute weekend away at this hotel and we were very pleased and would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We phoned ahead to ask if we could drop our bikes and luggage off before heading off for the afternoon - this was happily accommodated and our bikes were stored in the garage with no problems.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was just the right size and had tea and coffee making facilities as well as plenty of towels and a hairdryer. There was a small television with a good selection of channels. The rooms have been kept simple in their decor and looked lovely, I especially liked the bathroom being up a step as it felt very separate to the room which was nice. The bed was very comfortable and we slept well.
reviews.title: Excellent value stay in the Fens

reviews.text: Full English breakfast was available but Pat asked us what we wanted each morning and adapted it to suit us. Cereal and fruit juice was also on offer.
reviews.title: A good place to stay
